</Frame>

## Sharing preview deployments

Preview deployments can be publicly accessible or restricted to authenticated users.

**Public access**: Preview URLs are publicly viewable by default. Share a preview link with anyone who needs to review your changes.

**Restricted access**: Enable preview deployment authentication to limit preview access to authenticated Mintlify users only. See [Authentication Setup](/deploy/authentication-setup) for more information.


# Reverse proxy
Source: https://mintlify.localhost:3000/deploy/reverse-proxy

Configure a custom reverse proxy to serve your documentation

<Note>
  Reverse proxy configurations are only supported for [Custom plans](https://mintlify.com/pricing?ref=reverse-proxy).
</Note>

To serve your documentation through a custom reverse proxy, you must configure routing rules, caching policies, and header forwarding.

When you implement a reverse proxy, monitor for potential issues with domain verification, SSL certificate provisioning, authentication flows, performance, and analytics tracking.

## Routing configuration

Proxy these paths to your Mintlify subdomain with the specified caching policies:

| Path                              | Destination                     | Caching       |
| --------------------------------- | ------------------------------- | ------------- |
| `/.well-known/acme-challenge/*`   | `<your-subdomain>.mintlify.app` | No cache      |
| `/.well-known/vercel/*`           | `<your-subdomain>.mintlify.app` | No cache      |
| `/mintlify-assets/_next/static/*` | `<your-subdomain>.mintlify.app` | Cache enabled |
| `/_mintlify/*`                    | `<your-subdomain>.mintlify.app` | No cache      |
| `/*`                              | `<your-subdomain>.mintlify.app` | No cache      |
| `/`                               | `<your-subdomain>.mintlify.app` | No cache      |

## Required header configuration

Configure your reverse proxy with these header requirements:

* **Origin**: Contains the target subdomain `<your-subdomain>.mintlify.app`
* **X-Forwarded-For**: Preserves client IP information
* **X-Forwarded-Proto**: Preserves original protocol (HTTP/HTTPS)
* **X-Real-IP**: Forwards the real client IP address
* **User-Agent**: Forwards the user agent

<Warning>
  Ensure that the `Host` header is not forwarded
</Warning>

## Example nginx configuration

```nginx  theme={null}
server {
    listen 80;
    server_name <your-domain>.com;

    # Let's Encrypt verification paths
    location ~ ^/\.well-known/acme-challenge/ {
        proxy_pass https://<your-subdomain>.mintlify.app;
        proxy_set_header Origin <your-subdomain>.mintlify.app;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
        proxy_set_header User-Agent $http_user_agent;

        # Disable caching for verification paths
        add_header Cache-Control "no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate";
    }

    # Vercel verification paths
    location ~ ^/\.well-known/vercel/ {
        proxy_pass https://<your-subdomain>.mintlify.app;
        proxy_set_header Origin <your-subdomain>.mintlify.app;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
        proxy_set_header User-Agent $http_user_agent;

        # Disable caching for verification paths
        add_header Cache-Control "no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate";
    }

    # Static assets with caching
    location ~ ^/mintlify-assets/_next/static/ {
        proxy_pass https://<your-subdomain>.mintlify.app;
        proxy_set_header Origin <your-subdomain>.mintlify.app;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
        proxy_set_header User-Agent $http_user_agent;

        # Enable caching for static assets
        add_header Cache-Control "public, max-age=86400";
    }

    # Mintlify-specific paths
    location ~ ^/_mintlify/ {
        proxy_pass https://<your-subdomain>.mintlify.app;
        proxy_set_header Origin <your-subdomain>.mintlify.app;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
        proxy_set_header User-Agent $http_user_agent;

        # Disable caching for Mintlify paths
        add_header Cache-Control "no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate";
    }

    # Root path
    location = / {
        proxy_pass https://<your-subdomain>.mintlify.app;
        proxy_set_header Origin <your-subdomain>.mintlify.app;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
        proxy_set_header User-Agent $http_user_agent;

        # Disable caching for dynamic content
        add_header Cache-Control "no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate";
    }

    # All other documentation paths
    location / {
        proxy_pass https://<your-subdomain>.mintlify.app;
        proxy_set_header Origin <your-subdomain>.mintlify.app;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
        proxy_set_header User-Agent $http_user_agent;

        # Disable caching for dynamic content
        add_header Cache-Control "no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate";
    }
}
```

## Troubleshooting

### 404 error

**Symptoms**: Documentation loads, but features don't work. API calls fail.

**Cause**: `Host` header is being forwarded or `Origin` header is missing.

**Solution**:

* Remove `Host` header forwarding
* Set `Origin` header to `<your-subdomain>.mintlify.app`

### Performance issues

**Symptoms**: Slow page loads and layout shifts.

**Cause**: Incorrect caching configuration.

**Solution**: Enable caching only for `/mintlify-assets/_next/static/*` paths.


# AWS Route 53 and CloudFront
Source: https://mintlify.localhost:3000/deploy/route53-cloudfront

Host documentation at a custom subpath using AWS services

To host your documentation at a custom subpath such as `yoursite.com/docs` using AWS Route 53 and CloudFront, you need to configure your DNS provider to point to your CloudFront distribution.

## Repository structure

Your documentation files must be organized within your repository to match your chosen subpath structure. For example, if you want your documentation at `yoursite.com/docs`, you would create a `docs/` directory with all of your documentation files.

## High-level overview

Route traffic to these paths with a Cache Policy of **CachingDisabled**:

* `/.well-known/acme-challenge/*` - Required for Let's Encrypt certificate verification
* `/.well-known/vercel/*` - Required for domain verification
* `/docs/*` - Required for subpath routing
* `/docs/` - Required for subpath routing

Route traffic to this path with a Cache Policy of **CachingEnabled**:

* `/mintlify-assets/_next/static/*`
* `Default (*)`	- Your websites landing page

All Behaviors must have the an **origin request policy** of `AllViewerExceptHostHeader`.

<img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/all-behaviors.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=54d70b32256a271160dca8f51a85be43" alt="CloudFront &#x22;Behaviors&#x22; page with 4 behaviors: /docs/*, /docs, Default, and /.well-known/*." data-og-width="1603" width="1603" data-og-height="365" height="365" data-path="images/cloudfront/all-behaviors.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/all-behaviors.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=68a8af85258ac81883983503556ad026 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/all-behaviors.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=35386a988b71413602a9de7571d9d0b3 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/all-behaviors.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=2b0411253ef116b698c81aa90877b34d 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/all-behaviors.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=c8370b98c6a943fb94c68a19eced0e42 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/all-behaviors.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=688d3a4c1154fde50ff968998e08fe1e 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/all-behaviors.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=ce125cf98f6d34cdf2c060243b432e1e 2500w" />

## Create CloudFront distribution

1. Navigate to [CloudFront](https://aws.amazon.com/cloudfront) inside the AWS console.
2. Select **Create distribution**.

<Frame>
    <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/create-distribution.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=1f37db91b2641111d47cbe82f876c1ab" alt="CloudFront Distributions page with the &#x22;Create distribution&#x22; button emphasized." data-og-width="3024" width="3024" data-og-height="922" height="922" data-path="images/cloudfront/create-distribution.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/create-distribution.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=cc5fc35ee1c3334c982d436bd0d3865e 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/create-distribution.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=669a0faf0e66f2a9bdab67d80d8b6084 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/create-distribution.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=82b3d82369374b4c337b4a4008ea02b4 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/create-distribution.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=3d643801e73cf04965f74e8724fffdfe 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/create-distribution.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=718ef2ed171cf07a8a42aaffb25dc060 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/create-distribution.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=1e4166cb54510da95c528070418e37d6 2500w" />
</Frame>

3. For the Origin domain, input `[SUBDOMAIN].mintlify.dev` where `[SUBDOMAIN]` is your project's unique subdomain.

<Frame>
    <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/origin-name.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=449c149b3b39e8c429d8d51b0c42e3cb" alt="CloudFront &#x22;Create distribution&#x22; page showing &#x22;acme.mintlify.dev&#x22; as the origin domain." data-og-width="1495" width="1495" data-og-height="1036" height="1036" data-path="images/cloudfront/origin-name.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/origin-name.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=5d5f5008f369f8c38e6703e2a759e7af 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/origin-name.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=3345083fc5eca46637b4b3d3b36d9fe5 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/origin-name.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=8b3b6e36df9aac3814183115f7170787 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/origin-name.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=822c9433c88215f9e36d792608099e71 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/origin-name.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=83469208f32395b02ba5ae82b2d3a19a 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/origin-name.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=e6142bca1498cbe52617e64a941d9a73 2500w" />
</Frame>

4. For "Web Application Firewall (WAF)," enable security protections.

<Frame>
    <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/enable-security-protections.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=5906ebffd8e486eb062d57839190e8c0" alt="Web Application Firewall (WAF) options with &#x22;Enable security protections&#x22; selected." data-og-width="1482" width="1482" data-og-height="877" height="877" data-path="images/cloudfront/enable-security-protections.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/enable-security-protections.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=39509f85c10584ac29c25f10d0b5548e 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/enable-security-protections.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=ded22f36c2e2968f7eec2b412fdeed45 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/enable-security-protections.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=1e0fc91ac5e00e2c98fb60182c9a832a 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/enable-security-protections.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=c39d4433d131807dc83df3504e13d9ee 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/enable-security-protections.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=945be03239f33c86006a1617f5b96fa6 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/enable-security-protections.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=d4d0ea6e430c1894ad02b6537c62e5f9 2500w" />
</Frame>

5. The remaining settings should be default.
6. Select **Create distribution**.

## Add default origin

1. After creating the distribution, navigate to the "Origins" tab.

<Frame>
    <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/origins.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=c7d2c7dbccf5b481d0a935014e383f88" alt="A CloudFront distribution with the &#x22;Origins&#x22; tab highlighted." data-og-width="3024" width="3024" data-og-height="1466" height="1466" data-path="images/cloudfront/origins.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/origins.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=507b089d0cb19f1249c497c1eb860e35 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/origins.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=8fb97a407bae832c24f95290e5c49eb4 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/origins.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=cccacc7b2c23c927261a1cbce5742d1e 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/origins.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=b072b1f61138ac6f878b0a71e246ab4e 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/origins.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=e875456289310736a62a796a0213e164 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/origins.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=c50b04210ce9a0938b71dc6fd623eb61 2500w" />
</Frame>

2. Find your staging URL that mirrors the main domain. This is highly variant depending on how your landing page is hosted. For example, the Mintlify staging URL is [mintlify-landing-page.vercel.app](https://mintlify-landing-page.vercel.app).

<Info>
  If your landing page is hosted on Webflow, use Webflow's staging URL. It would look like `.webflow.io`.

  If you use Vercel, use the `.vercel.app` domain available for every project.
</Info>

3. Create a new Origin and add your staging URL as the "Origin domain."

<Frame>
    <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-origin.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=431b8e69daee80418361d8e0df65aaa7" alt="CloudFront &#x22;Create origin&#x22; page with a &#x22;Origin domain&#x22; input field highlighted." data-og-width="3024" width="3024" data-og-height="1332" height="1332" data-path="images/cloudfront/default-origin.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-origin.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=0192672b46582c1ae6e0cfab1c148a0e 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-origin.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=f703233de8846d03335ac59db3593477 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-origin.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=af17aba3b8dcb53f5c52a9dfbae56ab0 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-origin.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=4596db53f6895f7ae4a41c855731dc8c 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-origin.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=714110d7b3e0bab31bb044b9d973c382 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-origin.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=3da26c30610554351a3bd8f261f2807c 2500w" />
</Frame>

By this point, you should have two Origins: one with `[SUBDOMAIN].mintlify.app` and another with your staging URL.

<Frame>
    <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/final-origins.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=34c7c4de9810506a2bf5447c407c3707" alt="CloudFront &#x22;Origins&#x22; page with two origins: One for mintlify and another for mintlify-landing-page." data-og-width="1230" width="1230" data-og-height="690" height="690" data-path="images/cloudfront/final-origins.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/final-origins.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=2d9d966efc42fe601f71b34cd75a440f 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/final-origins.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=5cb2e516bfac6ecd70704d96e2efe881 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/final-origins.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=f370500f5a779ef1ea07869999abf5b5 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/final-origins.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=3c1599fc0aeb4aaf7c55b0094133a0c4 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/final-origins.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=a70c21541625be38eafef7651756ed2f 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/final-origins.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=9e16dae71fccebc80d015fdd2f4c14a5 2500w" />
</Frame>

## Set behaviors

Behaviors in CloudFront enable control over the subpath logic. At a high level, we're looking to create the following logic:

* **If a user lands on your custom subpath**, go to `[SUBDOMAIN].mintlify.dev`.
* **If a user lands on any other page**, go the current landing page.

1. Navigate to the "Behaviors" tab of your CloudFront distribution.

<Frame>
    <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/behaviors.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=c4509c758a6353ceee64b5d62ee66c7c" alt="CloudFront &#x22;Behaviors&#x22; tab highlighted." data-og-width="3024" width="3024" data-og-height="1384" height="1384" data-path="images/cloudfront/behaviors.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/behaviors.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=668d0905149b18b82ec126c61c0b215b 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/behaviors.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=a2509a0ce2738493a3fc6dc37be0f08d 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/behaviors.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=73d78087c73a8808dc9550fc1ded57ab 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/behaviors.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=66b36c3e19fd3eddf1c6ae31961ad63c 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/behaviors.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=94e69e532750b1445c6e2ff3f16cd58d 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/behaviors.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=73017a7f49e8a9e90a0b5de099503c8a 2500w" />
</Frame>

2. Select the **Create behavior** button and create the following behaviors.

### `/.well-known/*`

Create behaviors for Vercel domain verification paths with a **Path pattern** of `/.well-known/*` and set **Origin and origin groups** to your docs URL.

For "Cache policy," select **CachingDisabled** to ensure these verification requests pass through without caching.

<Frame>
    <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/well-known-policy.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=67ee03ce9da55fce3d969f481a7a2311" alt="CloudFront &#x22;Create behavior&#x22; page with a &#x22;Path pattern&#x22; of &#x22;/.well-known/*&#x22; and &#x22;Origin and origin groups&#x22; pointing to the staging URL." data-og-width="1413" width="1413" data-og-height="1098" height="1098" data-path="images/cloudfront/well-known-policy.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/well-known-policy.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=1458960df73ee7dfb9f446ef55254ab7 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/well-known-policy.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=62040f828b220b8e4990b964caa8adc0 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/well-known-policy.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=eaf6263c3f39dec9aef6684893585a9c 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/well-known-policy.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=517e8db63c9f10c74d04ec0ab20cbed2 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/well-known-policy.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=248ec909df24ff948bbe4df30707536f 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/well-known-policy.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=e085be4ba08ce27c1da5538ee1e05086 2500w" />
</Frame>

<Info>
  If `.well-known/*` is too generic, it can be narrowed down to 2 behaviors at a minimum for Vercel:

  * `/.well-known/vercel/*` - Required for Vercel domain verification
  * `/.well-known/acme-challenge/*` - Required for Let's Encrypt certificate verification
</Info>

### Your custom subpath

Create a behavior with a **Path pattern** of your chosen subpath, for example `/docs`, with **Origin and origin groups** pointing to the `.mintlify.dev` URL (in our case `acme.mintlify.dev`).

* Set "Cache policy" to **CachingOptimized**.
* Set "Origin request policy" to **AllViewerExceptHostHeader**.
* Set Viewer Protocol Policy to **Redirect HTTP to HTTPS**

<Frame>
    <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/behavior-1.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=1d09a38f55dc1fbfce58faf8a627a690" alt="CloudFront &#x22;Create behavior&#x22; page with a &#x22;Path pattern&#x22; of &#x22;/docs/*&#x22; and &#x22;Origin and origin groups&#x22; pointing to the acme.mintlify.dev URL." data-og-width="1520" width="1520" data-og-height="1117" height="1117" data-path="images/cloudfront/behavior-1.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/behavior-1.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=ab81a4e2de6ff0f07b5d307f5a46d774 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/behavior-1.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=0fb16e23b4b1b00d59e738f222d31906 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/behavior-1.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=49efb3aa2695a4fb9b89e2fb149ea67e 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/behavior-1.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=78fa6998929bf73878e06cab85482021 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/behavior-1.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=c3027c797a9d99717ffa999ce8bd04aa 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/behavior-1.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=5ba12d53255a26e6abcbc3d220d5b656 2500w" />
</Frame>

### Your custom subpath with wildcard

Create a behavior with a **Path pattern** of your chosen subpath followed by `/*`, for example `/docs/*`, and **Origin and origin groups** pointing to the same `.mintlify.dev` URL.

These settings should exactly match your base subpath behavior. With the exception of the **Path pattern**.

* Set "Cache policy" to **CachingOptimized**.
* Set "Origin request policy" to **AllViewerExceptHostHeader**.
* Set "Viewer protocol policy" to **Redirect HTTP to HTTPS**

### `/mintlify-assets/_next/static/*`

* Set "Cache policy" to **CachingOptimized**
* Set "Origin request policy" to **AllViewerExceptHostHeader**
* Set "Viewer protocol policy" to **Redirect HTTP to HTTPS**

### `Default (*)`

Lastly, we're going to edit the `Default (*)` behavior.

<Frame>
    <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-behavior-1.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=2ad9479b2b06f137c9aac688921b0872" alt="A CloudFront distribution with the &#x22;Default (*)&#x22; behavior selected and the Edit button emphasized." data-og-width="3024" width="3024" data-og-height="1406" height="1406" data-path="images/cloudfront/default-behavior-1.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-behavior-1.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=801e5f0228591da6475af62aa32fd5af 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-behavior-1.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=1ca26ed54199ede2f36525b6a1f04221 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-behavior-1.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=6f03bebdcae8314aec927882a69da382 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-behavior-1.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=80a23009975c7af7f5569d7a8ae9a633 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-behavior-1.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=d3ac29cb1af13cabac0cab96eb0d01dc 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-behavior-1.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=4aadfb85a039e284dee36c9ec0ffa5c9 2500w" />
</Frame>

1. Change the default behavior's **Origin and origin groups** to the staging URL (in our case `mintlify-landing-page.vercel.app`).

<Frame>
    <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-behavior-2.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=30463de43eebd7f624633f1757b87360" alt="CloudFront &#x22;Edit behavior&#x22; page with the &#x22;Origin and origin groups&#x22; input field highlighted." data-og-width="3024" width="3024" data-og-height="1298" height="1298" data-path="images/cloudfront/default-behavior-2.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-behavior-2.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=4514f68842aba48bf4ef44a5fdc81912 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-behavior-2.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=da2ad97fb54d35d6d1bc720d92d3e1fa 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-behavior-2.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=3aec1153063a872ba1d50f35dd31a5b9 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-behavior-2.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=56f77c60898ce9b96d970bcb417f53b0 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-behavior-2.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=f0445a8b875159363012f5154f3ba1e9 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/default-behavior-2.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=7f4f5395c901abb4086540a1ce3dba77 2500w" />
</Frame>

2. Select **Save changes**.

### Check behaviors are set up correctly

If you follow the above steps, your behaviors should look like this:

<Frame>
    <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/all-behaviors.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=54d70b32256a271160dca8f51a85be43" alt="CloudFront &#x22;Behaviors&#x22; page with 4 behaviors: /docs/*, /docs, Default, and /.well-known/*." data-og-width="1603" width="1603" data-og-height="365" height="365" data-path="images/cloudfront/all-behaviors.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/all-behaviors.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=68a8af85258ac81883983503556ad026 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/all-behaviors.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=35386a988b71413602a9de7571d9d0b3 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/all-behaviors.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=2b0411253ef116b698c81aa90877b34d 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/all-behaviors.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=c8370b98c6a943fb94c68a19eced0e42 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/all-behaviors.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=688d3a4c1154fde50ff968998e08fe1e 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ/images/cloudfront/all-behaviors.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=zdW5Dy7s3S_tL7uQ&q=85&s=ce125cf98f6d34cdf2c060243b432e1e 2500w" />
</Frame>

## Preview distribution

You can now test if your distribution is set up properly by going to the "General" tab and visiting the **Distribution domain name** URL.

<Frame>
    <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/preview-distribution.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=26261c7fb8b2aea6e488baebd81da561" alt="CloudFront &#x22;General&#x22; tab with the &#x22;Distribution domain name&#x22; URL highlighted." data-og-width="3024" width="3024" data-og-height="1394" height="1394" data-path="images/cloudfront/preview-distribution.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/preview-distribution.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=00d0c20e49e022f9409a610200fb80b4 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/preview-distribution.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=179ae97c29db945fbac4112ac981e204 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/preview-distribution.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=77613d4d70196f5f355d3f50bb1eb9a5 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/preview-distribution.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=3ab4603cd24a1a31bdf7d36605fdaf86 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/preview-distribution.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=ac992029b7bb63b7865d470b63075fbe 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/preview-distribution.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=1001b4e5d85d354d0f407c70524ea175 2500w" />
</Frame>

All pages should be directing to your main landing page, but if you append your chosen subpath, for example `/docs`, to the URL, you should see it going to your Mintlify documentation instance.

## Connect with Route53

Now, we're going to bring the functionality of the CloudFront distribution into your primary domain.

<Note>
  For this section, you can also refer to AWS's official guide on [Configuring
  Amazon Route 53 to route traffic to a CloudFront
  distribution](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/Route53/latest/DeveloperGuide/routing-to-cloudfront-distribution.html#routing-to-cloudfront-distribution-config)
</Note>

1. Navigate to [Route53](https://aws.amazon.com/route53) inside the AWS console.
2. Navigate to the "Hosted zone" for your primary domain.
3. Select **Create record**.

<Frame>
    <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/route53-create-record.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=485f0365b67628b64b79a14ad6342da6" alt="Route 53 &#x22;Records&#x22; page with the &#x22;Create record&#x22; button emphasized." data-og-width="1540" width="1540" data-og-height="1238" height="1238" data-path="images/cloudfront/route53-create-record.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/route53-create-record.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=38fc9443b532bd46e59158e5a8946bef 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/route53-create-record.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=0ff0c115bb706bca07cb98c4ed60ce0f 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/route53-create-record.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=99150636009d8b8b6570acdbbfd2199b 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/route53-create-record.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=dbd65372b9670081fd007ae5ecd20465 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/route53-create-record.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=1b4004391efd2aa7227fa03f1694ac6f 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/cloudfront/route53-create-record.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=59525323cba5793ad2e9924d768d9cf1 2500w" />
</Frame>

4. Toggle `Alias` and then **Route traffic to** the `Alias to CloudFront distribution` option.

<Frame>
    <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/create-record-alias.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=1d56653e164128d0de8347cb8e2abb89" alt="Route 53 &#x22;Create record&#x22; page with the &#x22;Alias&#x22; toggle and the &#x22;Route traffic to&#x22; menu highlighted." data-og-width="3024" width="3024" data-og-height="1494" height="1494" data-path="images/cloudfront/create-record-alias.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/create-record-alias.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=f888ce7c89be2bdb6f90d640779e8210 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/create-record-alias.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=997e91b14a4f9c8c5b95bff32587d322 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/create-record-alias.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=2fa923401806b5ca36e1711b43add64e 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/create-record-alias.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=fc423fed0cfec1e8076d2af86f9bcb8a 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/create-record-alias.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=6226788b5523b3ef69d42d676c629bdd 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_/images/cloudfront/create-record-alias.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=KT_Q5fTvRvVCZfQ_&q=85&s=3bf67b8316ac03caf74c1f63d3ed265f 2500w" />
</Frame>

5. Select **Create records**.

<Note>
  You may need to remove the existing A record if one currently exists.
</Note>

Your documentation is now live at your chosen subpath for your primary domain.

<Note>
  After configuring your DNS, custom subdomains are usually available within a few minutes. DNS propagation can sometimes take 1-4 hours, and in rare cases up to 48 hours. If your subdomain is not immediately available, please wait before troubleshooting.
</Note>


# Vercel
Source: https://mintlify.localhost:3000/deploy/vercel

Host documentation at a custom subpath using Vercel

export const VercelJsonGenerator = () => {
  const [subdomain, setSubdomain] = useState('[SUBDOMAIN]');
  const [subpath, setSubpath] = useState('[SUBPATH]');
  const vercelConfig = {
    rewrites: [{
      source: "/_mintlify/:path*",
      destination: `https://${subdomain}.mintlify.app/_mintlify/:path*`
    }, {
      source: "/api/request",
      destination: `https://${subdomain}.mintlify.app/_mintlify/api/request`
    }, {
      source: `/${subpath}`,
      destination: `https://${subdomain}.mintlify.app/${subpath}`
    }, {
      source: `/${subpath}/llms.txt`,
      destination: `https://${subdomain}.mintlify.app/llms.txt`
    }, {
      source: `/${subpath}/llms-full.txt`,
      destination: `https://${subdomain}.mintlify.app/llms-full.txt`
    }, {
      source: `/${subpath}/sitemap.xml`,
      destination: `https://${subdomain}.mintlify.app/sitemap.xml`
    }, {
      source: `/${subpath}/robots.txt`,
      destination: `https://${subdomain}.mintlify.app/robots.txt`
    }, {
      source: `/${subpath}/:path*`,
      destination: `https://${subdomain}.mintlify.app/${subpath}/:path*`
    }, {
      source: "/mintlify-assets/:path+",
      destination: `https://${subdomain}.mintlify.app/mintlify-assets/:path+`
    }]
  };
  const copyToClipboard = () => {
    navigator.clipboard.writeText(JSON.stringify(vercelConfig, null, 2)).then(() => {
      console.log('Copied config to clipboard!');
    }).catch(err => {
      console.error("Failed to copy: ", err);
    });
  };
  return <div className="p-4 border dark:border-white/10 rounded-2xl not-prose space-y-4">
      <div className="space-y-4">
        <div>
          <label className="block text-sm text-zinc-950/70 dark:text-white/70 mb-1">
            Subdomain
          </label>
          <input type="text" value={subdomain} onChange={e => setSubdomain(e.target.value)} placeholder="your-subdomain" className="w-full p-1 text-sm rounded border dark:border-white/10 bg-transparent" />
        </div>
        <div>
          <label className="block text-sm text-zinc-950/70 dark:text-white/70 mb-1">
            Subpath
          </label>
          <input type="text" value={subpath} onChange={e => setSubpath(e.target.value)} placeholder="docs" className="w-full p-1 text-sm rounded border dark:border-white/10 bg-transparent" />
        </div>
      </div>
      <div className="relative">
        <button onClick={copyToClipboard} className="absolute top-2 right-2 p-2 rounded-lg transition-all duration-200 group">
          <svg width="18" height="18" viewBox="0 0 18 18" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" className="w-4 h-4 dark:text-white/60 text-gray-400 group-hover:text-gray-500 dark:group-hover:text-white/60 transition-colors">
            <path d="M14.25 5.25H7.25C6.14543 5.25 5.25 6.14543 5.25 7.25V14.25C5.25 15.3546 6.14543 16.25 7.25 16.25H14.25C15.3546 16.25 16.25 15.3546 16.25 14.25V7.25C16.25 6.14543 15.3546 5.25 14.25 5.25Z" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth="1.5" strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round"></path>
            <path d="M2.80103 11.998L1.77203 5.07397C1.61003 3.98097 2.36403 2.96397 3.45603 2.80197L10.38 1.77297C11.313 1.63397 12.19 2.16297 12.528 3.00097" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth="1.5" strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round"></path>
          </svg>
          <span className="absolute top-9 left-1/2 transform -translate-x-1/2 bg-primary text-white text-xs px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-lg opacity-0 group-hover:opacity-100 transition-opacity duration-200 whitespace-nowrap">
            Copy
          </span>
        </button>
        <pre className="p-4 rounded-lg overflow-auto text-xs border dark:border-white/10">
          <code>{JSON.stringify(vercelConfig, null, 2)}</code>
        </pre>
      </div>
    </div>;
};

## vercel.json file

The `vercel.json` file configures how your project is built and deployed. It sits in your project's root directory and controls various aspects of your deployment, including routing, redirects, headers, and build settings.

We use the `rewrites` configuration to proxy requests from your main domain to your documentation.

Rewrites map incoming requests to different destinations without changing the URL in the browser. When someone visits `yoursite.com/docs`, Vercel internally fetches content from `your-subdomain.mintlify.dev/docs`, but the user still sees `yoursite.com/docs` in their browser. This is different from redirects, which send users to another URL entirely.

You can customize the subpath to any value you prefer, such as `/docs`, `/help`, or `/guides`. Additionally, you can use deeply nested subpaths like `/product/docs`.

## Configuration

### Host from `/docs`

1. Navigate to [Custom domain setup](https://dashboard.mintlify.com/settings/deployment/custom-domain) in your dashboard.
2. Click the **Host at `/docs`** toggle to the on position.

<Frame>
  <img alt="Screenshot of the Custom domain setup page. The Host at `/docs` toggle is on and highlighted by an orange rectangle." src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg/images/subpath/toggle-light.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg&q=85&s=ac78e38c0f4d2c427446d97e0b9ecc8b" className="block dark:hidden" data-og-width="1438" width="1438" data-og-height="298" height="298" data-path="images/subpath/toggle-light.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg/images/subpath/toggle-light.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg&q=85&s=7c0720f495cb6aa3507a498ad5ebbe73 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg/images/subpath/toggle-light.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg&q=85&s=99c5b7cf5b7435b3123eb2a4ed986e7a 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg/images/subpath/toggle-light.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg&q=85&s=e58ab386f2c8df2d8fd15f0d5e72420c 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg/images/subpath/toggle-light.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg&q=85&s=991e5ea5cbbdfd881a3de31112764cd8 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg/images/subpath/toggle-light.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg&q=85&s=cd8dc0ca9213e5bee253f1fef93984dc 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg/images/subpath/toggle-light.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg&q=85&s=f4c06ab7f766eb2c8a7ca8a490d6bcb1 2500w" />

  <img alt="Screenshot of the Custom domain setup page. The Host at `/docs` toggle is on and highlighted by an orange rectangle." src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg/images/subpath/toggle-dark.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg&q=85&s=fe025448518d6e8373e9275f5617b5ae" className="hidden dark:block" data-og-width="1440" width="1440" data-og-height="300" height="300" data-path="images/subpath/toggle-dark.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg/images/subpath/toggle-dark.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg&q=85&s=24193634fe247ede083cda84ded0638d 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg/images/subpath/toggle-dark.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg&q=85&s=be3a35bb83fc56efeed66c504129452f 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg/images/subpath/toggle-dark.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg&q=85&s=db296573c74628a58fa241cc877f42fd 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg/images/subpath/toggle-dark.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg&q=85&s=cdfea7b76c3d67068fb5caea5d9ed6bd 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg/images/subpath/toggle-dark.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg&q=85&s=81d2b0062e631367555c9663712e6e82 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg/images/subpath/toggle-dark.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=jUW68gfuWPLFPNlg&q=85&s=3a9cd576ae857b3a42fa149d71db77fe 2500w" />
</Frame>

3. Enter your domain.
4. Select **Add domain**.
5. Add the following rewrites to your `vercel.json` file. Replace `[subdomain]` with your subdomain:

```json  theme={null}
{
  "rewrites": [
    {
      "source": "/docs",
      "destination": "https://[subdomain].mintlify.dev/docs"
    },
    {
      "source": "/docs/:match*",
      "destination": "https://[subdomain].mintlify.dev/docs/:match*"
    }
  ]
}
```

* **`source`**: The path pattern on your domain that triggers the rewrite.
* **`destination`**: Where the request should be proxied to.
* **`:match*`**: A wildcard that captures any path segments after your subpath.

For more information, see [Configuring projects with vercel.json: Rewrites](https://vercel.com/docs/projects/project-configuration#rewrites) in the Vercel documentation.

### Host from custom path

To use a custom subpath (any path other than `/docs`), you must organize your documentation files within your repository to match your subpath structure. For example, if your documentation is hosted at `yoursite.com/help`, your documentation files must be in a `help/` directory.

Use the generator below to create your rewrites configuration. Add the rewrites to your `vercel.json` file.

<VercelJsonGenerator />

## Using external proxies with Vercel

If you're using an external proxy (like Cloudflare or AWS CloudFront) in front of your Vercel deployment, you must configure it properly to avoid conflicts with Vercel's domain verification and SSL certificate provisioning.

Improper proxy configuration can prevent Vercel from provisioning Let's Encrypt SSL certificates and cause domain verification failures.

See the [supported providers](https://vercel.com/guides/how-to-setup-verified-proxy#supported-providers-verified-proxy-lite) in the Vercel documentation.

### Required path allowlist

Your external proxy must allow traffic to these specific paths without blocking, redirecting, or heavily caching:

* `/.well-known/acme-challenge/*` - Required for Let's Encrypt certificate verification
* `/.well-known/vercel/*` - Required for Vercel domain verification
* `/mintlify-assets/_next/static/*` - Required for static assets

These paths should pass through directly to your Vercel deployment without modification.

### Header forwarding requirements

Ensure that your proxy correctly forwards the `HOST` header. Without proper header forwarding, verification requests will fail.

### Testing your proxy setup

To verify your proxy is correctly configured:

1. Test that `https://[yourdomain].com/.well-known/vercel/` returns a response.
2. Ensure SSL certificates are provisioning correctly in your Vercel dashboard.
3. Check that domain verification completes successfully.


# Visual editor
Source: https://mintlify.localhost:3000/editor

Create, maintain, and publish documentation in your browser

<img className="hidden dark:block my-0 pointer-events-none" src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/editor-dark.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=ebb3008d2a693c8f59b81604d8af020c" alt="Mintlify visual editor interface in dark mode" data-og-width="1184" width="1184" data-og-height="320" height="320" data-path="images/editor/editor-dark.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/editor-dark.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=897a34f742d17777be42a116fa6a0a88 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/editor-dark.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=5f906b115a5437309ef331fb7c9acf4c 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/editor-dark.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=c874875d4930351239d3d3d01781d844 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/editor-dark.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=80271b46bd9d53a8985c1a0d1646c740 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/editor-dark.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=358e49b23f7ee3d0917d203584a8ba58 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/editor-dark.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=bc5962c71d3460d84dc28ae6f6408ee8 2500w" />

Access the visual editor from your [dashboard](https://dashboard.mintlify.com/editor) to manage your documentation directly in your browser.

* **WYSIWYG editing**: Make changes to your documentation using a what-you-see-is-what-you-get (WYSIWYG) editor that shows how your content will look when published.
* **Git synchronization**: All changes automatically sync with your Git repository to maintain version control.
* **Team collaboration**: Multiple people can work on documentation simultaneously.
* **Component integration**: Add callouts, code blocks, and other components with slash commands.
* **No setup required**: Start writing immediately from your dashboard.

## Overview

Here is how you'll typically work in the visual editor:

<Steps>
  <Step title="Choose your branch">
    Create a branch or make changes directly to your deployment branch. We recommend creating a branch so that you can preview your changes before they go live.
  </Step>

  <Step title="Open your file">
    Navigate to an existing file in the sidebar or create a new one using the file explorer.
  </Step>

  <Step title="Edit your content">
    Make changes in the visual editor. Press <kbd>/</kbd> to open the component menu.
  </Step>

  <Step title="Preview your changes">
    Visual mode shows you how your changes will appear on your live site. Use this to verify everything looks correct.
  </Step>

  <Step title="Publish your changes">
    If you're working on your deployment branch, publish your changes directly from the visual editor. On other branches, you'll create a pull request for review before publishing.
  </Step>
</Steps>

## Editor modes

The visual editor has two modes to accommodate different editing preferences and needs: visual mode and Markdown mode.

Use the mode toggle in the editor toolbar to switch modes.

</Frame>

### Visual mode

Visual mode provides a WYSIWYG experience where changes that you make in the editor reflect how your published documentation will look. This mode is ideal for when you want to see how your changes will look in real-time.

<Frame>
  <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/visual-mode-light.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=59a9f60783e85d80b1daeed509fe47e0" alt="Visual editing mode in the Mintlify visual editor" className="block dark:hidden" data-og-width="3024" width="3024" data-og-height="1232" height="1232" data-path="images/editor/visual-mode-light.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/visual-mode-light.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=0702cb8556733851545809f75c9abae7 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/visual-mode-light.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=7a966802eca5df07402e94d0cd9c1d93 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/visual-mode-light.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=69c8847c2dfb117ccae89c8bbe79a32e 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/visual-mode-light.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=9250d61e55b853570f3f92332fa720bf 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/visual-mode-light.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=59ee630e6e9b1dc5b3b7adfc66586a97 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/visual-mode-light.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=f52b96f52e75443e5aea7e54efe5bb8b 2500w" />

</Frame>

### Markdown mode

Markdown mode provides direct access to the underlying `MDX` code of your documentation. This mode is ideal for when you need precise control over component properties or when you prefer to write in Markdown syntax.

<Frame>
  <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/markdown-mode-light.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=2f7a8c0a43d5e8ca86b3dd1f2ed21cea" alt="Markdown mode in the Mintlify visual editor" className="block dark:hidden" data-og-width="3024" width="3024" data-og-height="1248" height="1248" data-path="images/editor/markdown-mode-light.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/markdown-mode-light.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=0fb0be6440b294de2ddfc72b855addb3 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/markdown-mode-light.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=6cee7963ac970a2a2e0022b52e0aca0b 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/markdown-mode-light.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=cbd6bb3f80aaa6e35d8b2ececb0be790 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/markdown-mode-light.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=16a0f002f87c611ecbeeee0eaa206dcd 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/markdown-mode-light.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=40c57f06e1616c91c7ad7cb728fa776e 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/markdown-mode-light.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=dce9c190d248a49dbcaf479da03a524b 2500w" />

</Frame>

## Manage content

### Navigate your files

Use the sidebar file explorer to browse your documentation files. Click on any file to open it in the editor.

Press <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>P</kbd> on macOS or <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>P</kbd> on Windows to search for files by name.

### Create new pages

Select the **Create a new file** icon in the file explorer sidebar.

Filenames are automatically appended with a `.mdx` extension. To change the file type, click the file extension. Select the file type you want from the dropdown menu.

### Rename pages

To rename a page, click the kebab menu icon for the file you want to rename. Select **Rename** from the dropdown menu.

<Frame>
  <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/rename-light.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=d6691d7f7a5e54089f6ed13aa79e2537" className="block dark:hidden" alt="Rename page in the visual editor." data-og-width="968" width="968" data-og-height="366" height="366" data-path="images/editor/rename-light.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/rename-light.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=3e6c5d7217eac0f5cb85bfa7727e37aa 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/rename-light.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=214bc3acb604dfd5684b1d87e5fe79cf 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/rename-light.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=89e9d19082e64f0e585664e06af702a8 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/rename-light.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=3ebccfa07480008ad09ef44ed7e3d326 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/rename-light.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=96b17c3ff35d75c08e1d26aa906aa87a 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/rename-light.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=51328384ad4fd2894b2c43a9eb48eef8 2500w" />

</Frame>

### Delete pages

To delete a page, click the kebab menu icon for the file you want to delete. Select **Delete** from the dropdown menu.

<Frame>
  <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/delete-page-light.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=60941ea82cfd8c0d893c91b6e7ce2b93" className="block dark:hidden" alt="Delete page in the visual editor." data-og-width="968" width="968" data-og-height="366" height="366" data-path="images/editor/delete-page-light.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/delete-page-light.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=911273db0ec873af7cf29ee3da7e587e 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/delete-page-light.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=829b8d6995c91de5331d247a5a4859a9 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/delete-page-light.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=6602332921d46e21ae27d688b8378e77 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/delete-page-light.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=5e378731148e1199efe9dda7039f4630 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/delete-page-light.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=6c0fde219f5f37b35b848b20a2d210f9 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/delete-page-light.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=874825ac0d5acf40494a58988701cb4e 2500w" />

  <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/delete-page-dark.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=2743087f9842bf0ce81390e585301390" className="hidden dark:block" alt="Delete page in the visual editor in dark mode." data-og-width="968" width="968" data-og-height="366" height="366" data-path="images/editor/delete-page-dark.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/delete-page-dark.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=c6f74615b8cc934ba812f9ca363aefd4 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/delete-page-dark.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=751b504e410c5ef18cf1d164c3d70c99 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/delete-page-dark.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=0f3e2ef4ee4ab127336e8f45c9541c0e 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/delete-page-dark.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=362e516e583f4fb6a0e7d82404699609 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/delete-page-dark.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=0a1a11ad1d071a72185da16cdd404213 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/7OPTehQpVCaLhpve/images/editor/delete-page-dark.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=7OPTehQpVCaLhpve&q=85&s=d0939045b0015f534d6164ca41d137e5 2500w" />
</Frame>

### Organize your navigation

Edit your `docs.json` file to add new pages and remove deleted pages from your site navigation. See [Navigation](/organize/navigation) for more information on how to organize pages.

**Example: Add a Themes page to the Profile group**

In this example, you created a new page titled Themes and you want to add it to the Profile group in your documentation. Add the path to the new page to the `pages` array of the `Profile` group in your `docs.json` file for it to appear in your site navigation.

```json title="Adding a Themes page to the Profile group" highlight="18" theme={null}
{
    "navigation": {
        "groups": [
            {
                "group": "Getting started",
                "pages": [
                    "index",
                    "quickstart",
                    "installation"
                ]
            },
            {
                "group": "Profile",
                "pages": [
                    "settings",
                    "account-types",
                    "dashboard",
                    "themes"
                ]
            }
        ]
    }
}
```

### Edit content

Make changes to your pages using visual mode or Markdown mode in the editor.

In visual mode, press <kbd>/</kbd> to open the component menu. Add content blocks, callouts, code blocks, and other components to customize your documentation.

<Frame>
  <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/component-menu-light.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=a3712545013909860d85745e8b634311" alt="The unfurled component menu emphasized in the Mintlify visual editor" className="block dark:hidden" data-og-width="3024" width="3024" data-og-height="1592" height="1592" data-path="images/editor/component-menu-light.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/component-menu-light.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=0f9c38fcd572c1b9ffc6cfc570e429ea 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/component-menu-light.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=222aa6a7b33f58d40e71058169a61e14 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/component-menu-light.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=1e4d46153488490c7a552456fe296985 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/component-menu-light.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=c6337ec1af8115b56fef5da1180143a3 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/component-menu-light.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=a2b2484e467c00141ce8c0e1f7124270 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/component-menu-light.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=efc46ac2f99c1b86e993efe5fb1d289f 2500w" />

</Frame>

In Markdown mode, you directly edit the `MDX` of your pages. This can be helpful when you need to:

* Set specific component properties
* Work with complex nested components
* Copy and paste `MDX` content from other sources

See [Format text](/create/text) and [Format code](/create/code) for more information on how to write using Markdown syntax.

## Publish your changes

The branch that you work on determines how the editor publishes your changes:

* **Deployment branch**: Publishing updates your live site immediately.
* **Other branches**: Publishing creates a pull request so you can review changes before deploying them to production.

<Frame>
  <img src="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/publish-flow-light.png?fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=2f62bfeb814652a805c60f9cb108036c" alt="The publish button emphasized in the Mintlify visual editor" className="block dark:hidden" data-og-width="3024" width="3024" data-og-height="1046" height="1046" data-path="images/editor/publish-flow-light.png" data-optimize="true" data-opv="3" srcset="https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/publish-flow-light.png?w=280&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=a527c6e6f3ce790828b16a2d49ab47ff 280w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/publish-flow-light.png?w=560&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=f927bdc8c05e8e3f6683cf0f594f537d 560w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/publish-flow-light.png?w=840&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=0a9cd371bb79cd701f3cbab592119203 840w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/publish-flow-light.png?w=1100&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=12c7393d429df4c9de2160e5fea5c31c 1100w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/publish-flow-light.png?w=1650&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=fdcbdac53129ecb51e79bd7002e2117e 1650w, https://dev.mintcdn.com/mintlify/Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai/images/editor/publish-flow-light.png?w=2500&fit=max&auto=format&n=Khh2tU2DRm-hiGai&q=85&s=9270d07809f270e07ac943ff0d402958 2500w" />
